'''Lehudib's Crystal Spear''' (or '''LCS''') is a level 8 [[Conjurations]]/[[Earth Magic]] spell that launches a powerful, irresistible projectile at a single target.

==Strategy==
This spell is essentially an upgraded version of [[Iron Shot]]; LCS deals high damage that no monster has a resistance to. However, it has a high [[MP]] cost, very short range, can be blocked or evaded, and relatively low MP efficiency. When fighting a group of monsters, save it for taking out dangerous foes ([[orbs of fire]], [[Pandemonium lord]]s, [[fiend]]s, [[hell sentinel]]s, etc.) quickly, then switch to a lesser spell for the rest.

LCS might be powerful, but you may want to use Iron Shot instead. Iron Shot takes less XP to use, and is usually sufficient to clear a 3-rune game. Also, it has a 1 tile greater range. LCS is useful if you want to kill enemies faster, and/or if you have spare XP and spell levels to burn. In addition, you might want LCS if you are also using [[Spellforged Servitor]], so that the servitor can have the stronger spell.

===Tips & Tricks===
* [[Borgnjor's Vile Clutch]] combos well with Lehudib's Crystal Spear -- pinning enemies in place reduces their [[ev]]asion, allowing you to set up a lethal one-two punch.

==Monster Version==
Certain fearsome monsters can also cast Lehudib's Crystal Spear, often with the ability to one- or two-shot unprepared or fragile adventurers. Even the weakest casters can inflict up to 69 damage with it, while the most powerful ([[ancient lich]]es) can deal up to 144. It is entirely possible for a monster to cast this multiple times in a row, so make these enemies a very high priority in combat.

The monster version of this spell functions identically to the player version, except with a much more variable damage output:

 monster_spell_damge = 3d(16 + power / 10)
   where power = 12 * monster_hit_dice

{{monsters with spell}}

The following enemy "casts" crystal spear via [[Conjure Living Spells]]:
*{{monsterlink|Walking crystal tome}} (2x 3d34)

==History==
* Prior to [[0.27]], this spell could only be found in the [[Book of Annihilations]].
* Prior to [[0.14]], there was also an [[unrand]] [[spear]] known as [[Lehudib's Crystal Spear (unrand)|Lehudib's Crystal Spear]]. This was removed when spears were removed as viable [[throwing]] weapons.
